wikipedia_page.main:
John Phillipps Judd (8 June 1810 – 9 April 1888) was an English cricketer with amateur status who was active in 1831. He was born in Birchanger, Essex and died in Rickling, Essex. He made his first-class debut in 1831 and appeared in one match as an unknown handedness batsman whose bowling style is unknown, playing for Cambridge University. He scored eighteen runs with a highest score of 9 and took no wickets. 
He was educated at Eton and Trinity College, Cambridge.

response: John Judd (born 1942) is an English engineer.
